answers.answer: SOMETIME IF IT KEEPS GOING ON GO GET IT CHECKED OUT SOON LET ME NO

Hi,How are you? Migraines present with one-sided throbbing headaches which can be associated with nausea, vomiting, sensitivity to lights and sound. Dizziness may be due to other causes such as low blood pressure or low blood glucose levels eye or ear problem, and other underlying medical conditions such as anemia, diabetes and many more. If it persists, have this checked by your doctor for proper evaluation. Take care and regards.

question: can migranes cause light dizziness in the back of the head for months.?
title: dizziness in the back of my head
